trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ClickTime | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ClickTime | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use ClickTime with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use ClickTime with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ClickTime.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ClickTime.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A ClickTime tenant
trans-unit.target: A ClickTime tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ClickTime will be able to single sign into the application at your ClickTime company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ClickTime will be able to single sign into the application at your ClickTime company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ClickTime
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ClickTime

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ClickTime.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ClickTime.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type ClickTime.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type ClickTime.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select ClickTime, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select ClickTime, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ClickTime</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ClickTime</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ClickTime with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ClickTime with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your ClickTime tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your ClickTime tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In order to be able to configure single sign-on on your ClickTime tenant, you need to contact first the ClickTime technical support to get this feature enabled.
trans-unit.target: In order to be able to configure single sign-on on your ClickTime tenant, you need to contact first the ClickTime technical support to get this feature enabled.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the ClickTime application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the ClickTime application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to ClickTime page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to ClickTime page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at ClickTime page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at ClickTime page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your ClickTime company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your ClickTime company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Preferences, and then click Security Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Preferences, and then click Security Settings.

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On Preferences configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On Preferences configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Allow sign-in using Single Sign-On (SSO) with OneLogin.
trans-unit.target: Select Allow sign-in using Single Sign-On (SSO) with OneLogin.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ClickTime dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Endpoint textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ClickTime dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Endpoint textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open the base-64 encoded certificate in Notepad, copy the content, and then paste it into the X.509 Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open the base-64 encoded certificate in Notepad, copy the content, and then paste it into the X.509 Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ClickTime, they must be provisioned into ClickTime.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ClickTime, they must be provisioned into ClickTime.

trans-unit.source: In the case of ClickTime, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of ClickTime, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your ClickTime tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your ClickTime tenant.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Company, and then click People.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Company, and then click People.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Person.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Person.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Person</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Person</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New Person section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the New Person section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the email address textbox, type the email address of your Azure AD account.
trans-unit.target: In the email address textbox, type the email address of your Azure AD account.

trans-unit.source: In the full name textbox, type the name of your Azure AD account.
trans-unit.target: In the full name textbox, type the name of your Azure AD account.

trans-unit.source: If you want to, you can set additional properties of the new person object.
trans-unit.target: If you want to, you can set additional properties of the new person object.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other ClickTime user account creation tools or APIs provided by ClickTime to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other ClickTime user account creation tools or APIs provided by ClickTime to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the ClickTime **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the ClickTime **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
